creator: dan@dotnetfirebird.org
text:
When running the following configuration on Windows XP Prof SP2 the Apache
2.0.54 server acting as a reverse proxy is a wrong HTTP request to the HTTP
server behind it.

When running exactly the same configuration on Windows Server 2003 SP1 there is
no problem.

When running the following configuration:

<VirtualHost *:8080>
	ServerAdmin 		admin@mysite
	ServerName 		mysite

	ProxyPreserveHost	On
	ProxyPass 		/ http://inside:8080/
	ProxyPassReverse 	/ http://inside:8080/

	ErrorLog 		logs/mysite-nossl-error.log
	TransferLog 		logs/mysite-nossl-access.log
	LogLevel Info
</VirtualHost>

The target server (http://inside:8080/) is receiving the following HTTP request:

GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: mysite:8080
Accept: image/gif, image/x-xbitmap, image/jpeg, image/pjpeg,
application/x-shockwave-flash, */*
Accept-Language: cs
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1)
Max-Forwards: 10
X-Forwarded-For: 192.168.4.2
X-Forwarded-Host: mysite:8080
X-Forwarded-Server: mysite
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: mysite:8080
Accept: image/gif, image/x-xbitmap, image/jpeg, image/pjpeg,
application/x-shockwave-flash, */*
Accept-Language: cs
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1)
Max-Forwards: 10
X-Forwarded-For: 192.168.4.2
X-Forwarded-Host: mysite:8080
X-Forwarded-Server: mysite

I have the same problem on Windows 2003 Server

see also bug: 34716


Vhost config:

<VirtualHost *:8080>
	ServerAdmin 		admin@mysite
	ServerName 		mysite
	ProxyPass 		/ http://inside:8080/
</VirtualHost>
creator: edwin.meester@qme.nl

text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 34716 ***
creator: rpluem@apache.org
